briefTitle: A Placebo Controlled Trial Of L-Tryptophan In Post-Operative Delirium
officialTitle: A Placebo Controlled Trial Of L-Tryptophan In Post-Operative Delirium

interventions.name: L-tryptophan supplementation
otherNames: L-tryptophan 1 gm PO TID starting the evening of surgery

summary: Post-operative delirium is a common and deleterious complication in elderly patients. The investigators have previously found lower levels of serum tryptophan in post-operative elderly patients who developed delirium in comparison to post-operative elderly patients who did not develop delirium. The investigators hypothesize that post-operative supplementation of L-tryptophan will reduce the duration and incidence of post-operative delirium. This study is a double-blinded placebo controlled trial of L-tryptophan supplementation in post-operative ICU patients 60 years and older. The primary outcome measure is the comparison of duration of post-operative delirium in subjects who receive L-tryptophan supplementation versus a similar appearing control.

primaryOutcome.timeFrame: post-operatively daily in ICU until discharged from ICU
